answers.q: how to fix e324 error edd
answers.a: E324 is the food-additive code for ethoxyquin, a synthetic antioxidant; an “E324 error” on an EDD system isn’t related to this additive—contact that service’s support for troubleshooting.

answers.q: what does e324 mean on edd
answers.a: In food labeling, E324 means ethoxyquin; if you’re seeing “E324” as an error on an EDD platform, it’s unrelated to the additive and refers to that system’s own code.

answers.q: what is error e324 on edd
answers.a: E324 denotes ethoxyquin in food-additive terms, not an EDD error; any “E324 error” on EDD is a system-specific code unrelated to the additive.
Limits vary by region: in the U.S., ethoxyquin is allowed in certain spices at up to 100 mg/kg (100 ppm), while it isn’t authorized as a food additive in the EU; always check your local regulations.

answers.q: ethoxyquin what level is safe paprika
answers.a: In the U.S., ethoxyquin may be used in paprika up to 100 mg/kg (100 ppm) as a color preservative; it is not permitted as a food additive in the EU.
